trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of all [Import](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3bfecaf1-69fd-4008-b651-c9dafd4389d9) elements in a project.
Allows hosts to programmatically add a new [<Import>](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3bfecaf1-69fd-4008-b651-c9dafd4389d9) tag to a project file being manipulated by the host.
A required string representing the name of the project file for the <Import> statement to be added.
For example, "myproject.csproj."
An optional string indicating whether the element is processed.
If condition is `true`, then the specified tag is added, if `false`, it is not.

Copies the entire <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref> to a compatible one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> of <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Import"></xref> objects, starting at the specified index of the target array.

The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> of <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Import"></xref> objects that is the destination of the elements copied from <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

Copies the entire <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref> to a compatible one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
Gets a value indicating the number of <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Import"></xref> objects in the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref>.
Each <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Import> object in the collection represents a element in the project.
An integer value representing the number of <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Import"></xref> objects in the collection.
Gets an enumerator that iterates through the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref>.

This method allows the caller to use the `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]) to iterate through the individual <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Import> objects in the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for the entire <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe).
`true` if access to the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Allows hosts to programmatically remove [<Import>](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/3bfecaf1-69fd-4008-b651-c9dafd4389d9) tags that are part of a project file being manipulated by the host.
Removing an import marks the project as dirty, which means that the project will be re-evaluated at some point during other operations on the project instance.
A string representing the name of the <Import> tag to remove from the project file.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref>.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.ImportCollection"></xref>.
